person1.name: Jason Carver
person1.bio: Since 2017, Jason has contributed in to the python tools listed on py.ethereum.org. This year, his primary focus has been on Trinity, the all-python client used by the EF Research team for Eth2.0. He is based out of San Francisco, CA.

person2.name: David Sanders
person2.bio: General purpose hacker with interests in ML, prog. lang. design, and distributed tech.  Also occasionally caught playing classical guitar, studying Japanese, or enjoying nature.

person3.name: Brian Cloutier
person3.bio: Brian was one of the very first people to lose money mining Bitcoin, anyone remember butterfly labs? At any given moment he's likely to be working on making Ethereum better, backpacking, thinking about cryptocurrencies, or eating sushi.

person4.name: Christoph
person4.bio: Software gardener. Pythoneer. Loving Father. Globetrotter. Cyclist. Working on Trinity the Ethereum client written in Python.

person5.name: Nicholas Lin
person5.bio: I love movies(sci-fi!) and video games(zombies!).
